image.altText: A portrait of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi Beach shooting

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley calls on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to recall parliament to implement a suite of changes to combat antisemitism.

title.children: PM announces reforms to combat 'evil scourge'

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: Chief Justice Lucy McCallum says Rick McGary has not accepted blame for the rapes, which occurred in Canberra in 2020 and 2016.

title.children: Former ANU academic jailed for six years for raping two people

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: The man who stabbed two Australian National University students in 2023 is given a nominated sentence of life to be carried out in a secure mental health facility.

title.children: ANU stabber 'may never be safe for release into the community'

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair in a paramedic uniform sits on a couch holding a baby in her arms.

props.synopsis: Rachel Szigeti was preparing to leave for the hospital to give birth to her second baby when she realised the moment had suddenly arrived. That was when her husband Cedric sprang into action and called paramedics.

title.children: Paramedics don't usually get to 'catch a baby', but this crew did

image.altText: A man in sunglasses speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Shakira Adams had no licence and methamphetamine in her system when she drove a stolen car at least 177 kilometres per hour into Matthew McLuckie's car.

title.children: Tom's son was killed in a horror crash. Today the driver got the maximum penalty

image.altText: An office building, with a sign that reads 'ACT Government'.

props.synopsis: A legislative inquiry has criticised the ACT government for aggressively recovering debts from people it found were ineligible for stamp duty concessions.

title.children: Home buyers hit by harsh debt pursuit, inquiry finds

image.altText: CSIRO sign generic

props.synopsis: Just a month after announcing 350 job cuts, the CSIRO has received a funding boost, but proposed job cuts will still happen, the national science agency says.

title.children: CSIRO receives $233m funding boost but up to 350 jobs still to go

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: A getaway driver who helped two teenagers flee the scene of a fatal crash near Parliament House is jailed in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Getaway driver from fatal Canberra crash jailed for more than three years

image.altText: Snicko shows a big spike as the ball passes the glove

props.synopsis: The correct decision is made in completely the wrong way as Jamie Smith makes it through a review shortly before falling to another on day two of the third Ashes Test. Follow live.

title.children: Calls for snicko to be 'sacked' as another DRS drama hits Ashes

image.altText: A blurred photo with the text "AI IMAGE" and an inset photo of a man's head.

props.synopsis: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman Naveed Akram in the Philippines and a fabricated Facebook page are spreading online. And an image of police officers taken out of context is debunked by ABC NEWS Verify.

title.children: AI deepfakes of Bondi gunman spread online

image.altText: A woman's silhouette as she texts on a phone while standing in front of a big image of an X.

props.synopsis: US social media platform X incentivised the spread of inflammatory misinformation in the wake of the Bondi Beach shootings, a digital media expert has said.

title.children: Why social media was flooded with lies after the Bondi shooting

image.altText: A graphic showing newspaper headlines

props.synopsis: Silvagni employed a legal team exclusively to fight for a suppression order, preventing his name from being reported by the media for more than a year.

title.children: How Tom Silvagni kept his name out of headlines before rape conviction

image.altText: A close up of Susie Wiles sitting at a table listening.

props.synopsis: The long-time political operator is unusually candid during a series of interviews with magazine Vanity Fair.

title.children: Who is Susie Wiles and why has she caused panic in Trump land?

image.altText: Firefighters worked to contain the blaze for around three hours at the Little Street site.

props.synopsis: A NSW oyster grower is left reeling after tens of thousands of dollars' worth of equipment went up in flames just a week away from Christmas.

title.children: Firefighters deem 'ferocious' 30m tall blaze at oyster farm suspicious

image.altText: A year 12 student facetimes their mum after receiving their ATAR mark

props.synopsis: Students at Delany College in Granville are among the 83,000 students across NSW who are learning of their HSC results on Thursday.

title.children: With a 98.70 ATAR, Sidney shared an elated video call with his mum

image.altText: A woman with a checkered shirt wearing a fixed microphone speaks at a conference

props.synopsis: The chief executive of Perth-based oil and gas producer Woodside, Meg O'Neill, resigns from the company effective immediately in order to take up the same role at BP.

title.children: Meg O'Neill resigns as Woodside chief to join energy giant

image.altText: A man standing on a sunny cliff in the city with water behind him

props.synopsis: A man who showed no remorse after a stabbing attack on his partner in their south Sydney home is sentenced to more than 26 years in jail for the woman's murder.

title.children: Man jailed for 'cowardly and inexcusable' murder of partner

image.altText: Exterior shot of the Brisbane Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: Crime and Corruption Commission (CCC) Queensland alleges five public officers accepted secret payments from sales representatives from a medical device company to place its equipment in the state's public hospitals.

title.children: Corruption charges laid against Qld public officers after 'extensive' probe

image.altText: A big vehicle in army colours of khaki and grey.

props.synopsis: The United States has approved its largest ever weapons package for Taiwan which is under increasing military pressure from China.

title.children: US approves largest ever weapons spending for Taiwan

image.altText: Dan Bongino looks to his side with wide eye, US flag behind, red tie, blue suit. His head is shaved.

props.synopsis: FBI deputy director Dan Bongino will step down from his post next month, ending a short but tumultuous tenure as the bureau's second-highest-ranking official.

title.children: FBI deputy to step down from role less than a year after appointment

image.altText: Albanese holds up a Medicare card.

props.synopsis: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

title.children: Party allegiance counts for little when there's $121 billion worth of problems

image.altText: A courtroom sketch shows Nick Reiner wearing a blue protective vest as he sits in the dock.

props.synopsis: Nick Reiner briefly faces court three days after he was arrested over the stabbing murders of his Hollywood director father, Rob Reiner, and mother, Michele Singer Reiner.

title.children: Rob Reiner's son Nick appears in court charged with parents' stabbing deaths

image.altText: KPop Demon Hunters

props.synopsis: From Australian-made gore to sugar-rush animation, here are the films that had our critics seated and watching this year.

title.children: The best new movies of 2025 from Sinners to KPop Demon Hunters

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Kerry Schott's report into the Triple Zero outage debacle increases pressure on Optus to implement 21 recommendations, some of them "urgent", and highlights numerous errors.

title.children: Optus in race against time after damning Triple Zero outage review

image.altText: Two air attendants pour water bottles over a burnt backpack in an overhead locker.

props.synopsis: The national transport safety regulator's report into a fire, which broke out on a flight to Tasmania earlier this year, has found the blaze was caused by a lithium-ion battery experiencing "thermal runaway".

title.children: Safety report released into overhead locker fire on Australian flight

image.altText: Man in patterned shirt smiling, leaning against tree.

props.synopsis: Prostate cancer survivor Mick Barrett is calling on businesses to consider installing rubbish bins inside men's bathrooms to help those with incontinence.

title.children: Sanitary bins aren't always in men's bathrooms. Here's why that's a problem

image.altText: An image of a boat parked on a suburban street, with parts of the boat blurred.

props.synopsis: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

title.children: Man denied bail for 'blatant' alleged display of Nazi symbols on boat

image.altText: A collage of a person with disability, a hand on a wheelchair and kids throwing a ball

props.synopsis: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

title.children: 'Shape up or ship out': NDIS providers warned as new rules confirmed

image.altText: Tracy Beaton smiles, has hands in pockets of black pants, wears glasses, green and beige printed shirt.

props.synopsis: The Allan Labor government has appointed Tracy Beaton to head the Commission for Children and Young People, as Victoria continues to grapple with its childcare crisis.

title.children: Victorian children's commissioner appointed after nine-month vacancy

image.altText: a person sitting on a rock looking at a grassy savanna

props.synopsis: The future of an isolated tourism hotspot home to stunning waterfalls and ancient rock art is uncertain following a Federal Court hearing in Darwin.

title.children: Future of isolated NT tourist hotspot uncertain following Federal Court case

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and earrings looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: NT Police has doubled its reward for information related to the disappearance of Angie Fuller, almost three years after her suspected murder in outback Australia.Â

title.children: 'We believe Angie was murdered': Fresh appeal for answers on missing mum

image.altText: A woman stands arms crossed in front of a pub window covered in Christmas decorations.

props.synopsis: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

title.children: Mum pays $1,000 a week to live in a motel in her home town

image.altText: A picture of the golden FIFA World Cup trophy on a pedestal at a reception ahead of the World Cup draw.

props.synopsis: FIFA has announced a record prize money pool for the 2026 men's World Cup, but the figures are dwarfed by the riches on offer for the biggest club competitions, and fly in the face of the deadline for parity with the women's tournament.Â

title.children: FIFA's record men's World Cup prize pool undermines equal pay goal

image.altText: Sam Kerr celebrates with teammate Johanna Rytting Kaneryd.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr heads in the winner as Chelsea secures a spot in the Women's Champions League quarterfinals.

title.children: Kerr scores the winner for Chelsea to lock in Champions League quarterfinal

image.altText: A man in a black suit looks into the camera as he reads from a sheet.

props.synopsis: Charles James Spencer-Churchill, 70, who is known as Jamie Blandford, is the 12th Duke of Marlborough, one of Britain's most senior aristocratic families.

title.children: UK's Duke of Marlborough charged with intentional strangulation
